Iâ€™m in the same position as you and itâ€™s horrible. Iâ€™m not long distance with my partner but he has a low sex drive and to me itâ€™s very hard as every guy Iâ€™ve dated has had a similar sex drive to me. Iâ€™m not exactly the horniest person alive but it hurts me to feel rejected and itâ€™s gotten to the point where I do feel resent. Like you, we argue a lot about it and I feel rejected and hurt. I think it hurts me because we went from being very passionate and happy to gradually him rarely initiating and me getting frustrated/upset each time, which obviously makes him feel worse. Itâ€™s something that currently has driven a wedge in my own relationship and I feel the same enotuons as you, that he doesnâ€™t make the effort anymore and I miss that feeling of him really wanting me. My boyfriend watches porn too and even though he still makes sexy comments towards me and kisses me etc, it doesnâ€™t feel like how it did when we started dating. There are times where itâ€™s amazing and I notice this happens on days where I am not overthinking/depressed. 

Itâ€™s an awful cycle to be in and I know how shit it can make you feel but you need to try and remember that men can have low sex drives, its always stereotyped that all men are sex crazy but it isnâ€™t true. He may feel embarrassed to discuss it and depression does make your libido lower itself. I would try having an open discussion with him and see what he says. Itâ€™s a tricky situation to be in because I think with BPD we need that physical reassurance that we are wanted and it must be even harder with long distance. Itâ€™s hard to know when we are being irrational or when our feelings are justified and with something like sex itâ€™s hard enough to discuss already. I hope you can sort things out with him. Sorry for the long response, just I read this and it really resonated with me.
